data.title: Delicious Brick Oven Pizza
data.text:
This was our first visit to Stoplight Pizza and we will likely eat there again.  The stuffed cheese sticks were excellent.  We selected Italian sausage for our stuffing, and really enjoyed them.  The side salad was good, but nothing special.  It was just a simple salad with Italian oil and vinegar dressing.

We enjoyed “The Farmer” specialty pizza.  It has bacon, ham, pepperoni, Italian and spicy sausage, onions, green bell peppers, mushrooms, banana peppers, jalapeños, black olives and lots of cheese.  The pizza dough is made fresh daily using the owner’s personal recipe, and the pizzas are baked in a brick oven.  This results in a nicely browned and crispy crust that is very flavorful. 

Most of the ingredients are prepared fresh daily, and the owner even pickles his own jalapeños.  Takeout orders are available, but if you enjoy a crispy crust, I would advise eating your pizza in the restaurant.  After 10 to 15 minutes in a cardboard box the crispy texture will probably not  survive.

data.title: Surprisingly Good
data.text: With all the new pizza places opening up trying something new can seem daunting but I've been here three times do far and haven't had a bad pie yet. The inside isn't much to look at but the pizza is terrific. Best crust in town, reminds me of Brooklyn style, priced really good and a TON of cheese for a normal portion. Oh yeah, the family that runs it are pretty cool too. I'd rather support the local community rather than a corporate juggernaut!!! Just try it

data.title: Decent lunch pizza
data.text: Went there for a quick lunch and we were the only group there.  Very nice people.  The pizza was okay - nothing great and the side salad was out of the bag with some cheese.  The price was great $5 for pizza and salad.

data.title: Decent pizza, if you must...
data.text:
On our way to Salt Lake City, we stopped in Idaho Falls for a night. It was a Sunday evening, and for some reason this particular town down have much open....so, after getting strikeouts at half a dozen other places, we chose this one. 

Start off by saying that, when my wife called for delivery, the guy said he was the only one there, that he had to make the pizza, then close the place down to deliver. This is not a bad thing, if anything it's actually positive, shows drive, conviction. Even though he was the only one, he was nice, delivery was surprisingly quick. 

As for the pizza, not so much. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad...but it wasn't really good either. Pretty basic flavor, toppings pretty spaced out. Not much more to say. Order here, you might not be disappointed, but it's not likely you'll be overly impressed.

data.title: GO TO PAPA TOMS
data.text: Paid for lg & md pizza for $30. Thin, bad tasting crust, no toppings, looked like a flat cheese pancake. Good reviews must have come from relation or friends.  I'd rather pay a little more at Papa Tom's and get good pizza.

data.title: EXCELLENT PLACE-HIGHLY RECOMMEND
data.text: The food was great! Excellent pizza, cheesy breadsticks and salad. Our food was very tasty!! Nick, our cook, prepared everything just right for us and our order was ready promptly. Brittany & Megan, our waitresses, were really good-made sure we had plenty of pop and that we were satisfied with our food. Prices were good, offered excellent value especially for our group. Highly recommend y'all check this out.

data.title: Not sure why, but the Ririe location makes a much better pizza than the Idaho Falls location
data.text: Every pizza I have ever gotten from the Ririe ID. location was excellent in every way. Lots of toppings, with cheese and very fresh ingredients. I was always amazed how a little hole in the wall in a little hole in the wall of a town could have such amazing pizza. And the crust is perfectly crisp. But the Idaho Falls location is not cutting it, at least the two pizzas we've gotten there. I'm going to give them one more chance and hope they've figured it out, but the last pizzas were skimpy on the toppings, doughy crust and not the freshest ingredients...... Here's hoping IF gets its act together. Maybe its because the owner spends most of his time at Ririe? I haven't seen him in IF yet?

data.title: Best Quality Pizza for any price hands down.
data.text: Pizza was worth every penny and more.  The ingredients were fresh, our service was great, bar none the best Pizza I've ever had.  We got the 32" 3 topping for $28.00 and the pizza tasted amazing.  We met the owner, great guy, very friendly, and they even gave us cheese sticks (their breadsticks) for free.  It is definitely a hole in the wall, but the quality of pizza made our experience one we recommend to all.  Check out the pictures if you're not convinced, otherwise my review includes a warning to not pay attention to the negative reviews and try the 32" otherwise you could miss out on an amazing opportunity.

data.title: That was some AMAZING PIZZA
data.text: Our family just moved here to Idaho and we had to feed nine of us so we ordered the 32" and boy was that big and YUMMY.  We had leftovers for a couple of days.  We moved here from Utah and getting this same size pizza with half the flavoring as Stoplight Pizza was almost double the price.  I will definitely be GOING BACK!!

data.title: Not worth the price
data.text: Not worth the hype. Pizza was alright. Sauce is bland. Received half order wrong. Definitely not worth the price you pay for two pizza ad breadsticks. Won't try again.

data.title: Skimpy on the Cheese
data.text: I have tried them twice. Nice flavor. If you like lots of dough. Skimpy on cheese. Friendly staff. I came for good pizza and will keep looking.

data.title: Love this pizza
data.text: Went with my sister for pizza. I have been here a number of times. Love their pizza. Great lunch special at a great price. A family favourite. A small spot but great pizza's from the small individual to an enormous fun to share. A must visit. Don't forget the pepperoni stuffed breadsticks.

data.title: Fabulous Pizza
data.text: This simple cozy pizza place is a fantastic surprise. The pizza is the best in Idaho Falls, and I've tried them all!  Inexpensive, hometown feel with friendly staff. I went for dinner with my sister and we were both pleasantly impressed!  Great variety, great taste, and great value!   We will certainly return often. Absolutely, the pizza is delicious!

data.title: Best Pizza Ever!!
data.text: I love this brick oven pizza!!  So happy to see this second location open up!!  Nice place, the food is wonderful, and they serve Pepsi!!!  The sampler is the way to go....cheese sticks and four different pizzas!!  Unless you're really hungry then I recommend the 32"!!  Haven't had a bad meal yet!!  They have salads too!  Yummmm!!
